About Me

Hello! 👋 Here's my resume.

Callforce

Full Stack Software Engineer
May, 2020 to Present

Callforce provides solutions for patient outreach, answering services and appointment handling, insurance verification, and other unique services to dental offices. I worked alongside FANG-experienced engineers on internal tools, such as an employee console for handling appointments and a list-filtering software that would orgnanize patient records into csvs, for our callers to contact, as well as an external, client-facing portal for our customers to view their patient's appointments through our services.

Skills
  • Underwent HIPAA compliance training for adequately handling patient-sensitive data.
  • Emphatically used React, Node, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform technologies (BigQuery, CRON jobs through Pubsubs, storage, VM instances, cloud-functions), SQL, Material-UI, and Tailwind.
  • Improved the readability of my code from learning alongside Adobe and Amazon engineers who gave constructive feedback on my PRs.
Accomplishments
  • Client offered $20,000 to have a custom built insurance verification table in the client-portal for viewing statuses of patient insurances. I completed this within 2 days.
  • Uncovered and fixed buggy code, not related to my assignments, that prevented Callforce's notification system (email and SMS updates) from working properly.
  • Created better, structured google cloud logs, outside of my assignments, for better error visibility in our more frequently used cloud-functions.
Projects
  • Client Portal
    • React-based web application that communicated with our nonSQL firestore DB through Google's Firebase SDK. It was built with Tailwind as a UI library for a cleaner, modern look for Callforce's clients. Clients could view appointments that were scheduled, see notes and action items (e.g. a patient could ask for the office to call them back about insurance and the client could mark that as an action taken.) from callers who had contacted patients, listen to voicemails, edit contact information as well as notifications pertaining to the services we offer (e.g. 'Receive texts and emails whenever a new patient is scheduled')
    • Built out the frontend alone and hit our MVP deadline of 2 months. Mockups were given to me by our CTO.
    • Leveraged localForage for client-side caching of nonsensitive data for better performance boost.
    • Unlike the previous portal design, this one supported DSO accounts which needed access to many offices. Callforce's previous portal suffered many performance issues and wasn't architected in a way that could support that sort of overview.
    • Our original clients, nonDSOs, responded very positively to the new portal. In the words of Callforce's CTO, 'This is best major release Callforce has ever had.'
  • DSO List Filtering Electron Application
    • An electron application for DSOs that filtered, sorted, and consolidated millions of patient records based on shared phone numbers and outputed office-specific csvs.
    • Built this alone within only a few weeks time.
    • Effect: Reduced operation overhead by supporting multiple lists filtering simultaneously, dividing DSO lists into office-level csvs for better accountability and handling among teams, prevented multiple calls on the same patient, and greatly sped up production of calls by eliminating filtering by hand.
  • Core Service Data Gathering: List Filtering Cloud-Functions for Practice Management Softwares and Five9 Reports
    • Built cloud-functions to support non-DSO dental office list filtering that returned csvs that would then be uploaded into the five9 queue for callers to call upon.
    • These filters would also track list sizes, before and after filtering, and post them to our firebase DB. These list sizes would then be mirrored in our SQL BigQuery tables which are then visualized in Tableau for better visibility of listSizes by office.
    • The supported Practice Management Softwares in these list-filtering cloud-functions are Curve, Denticon, Dentrix, DentrixAscend, EagleSoft, Open Dental, Mac Practice, and Practice Works.
    • Built PubSub functions that request Five9 reports, using SOAP, of our inbound and outbound call logs every 5 minutes, every work day from 8AM to 10PM, so Callforce's VP of operations and his analysts can have a live feed of our daily Call Volume.
    • Call volume data is stored in our BigQuery tables, along with listSizes, which is connected to our VP's tableau account for data visualization. Essentialy, because of these features and the data I was able to format and store, our operations VP has instant access to the state of each caller's progress throughout the day in nearly real-time.

    • Independent Contractor

    React/WordPress Developer
    Nov, 2019 to Nov, 2020

    I worked as a React developer for AccenaGroup on a map-editing tool for water inspectors leveraging the Konva library for shape building, and I also worked as a WordPress developer for retailconsultingteam.

    • Update clients daily on requested features and any issues encountered, and implement technologies that best serve the project.
    • Link to RetailConsultingTeam.

    Bright Bridge Web

    Project Manager && Full Stack Web Developer
    Feb, 2019 to Nov, 2019

    As an employee at Bright Bridge, I largely worked as a frontend developer specializing in React. Some of the more notable projects I engineered include ScriptureNotes study tool (learn more at scripturenotes.com) and ComplianceGo's Map Editor Tool (functionality will be greatly limited as a public user). I also managed development teams for IAchieveToday and the EventBookingPro app.

    • Correspond with clients with daily updates.
    • Lead weekly standups with task lists and roadmaps, and give directional advice on how to approach complex problems.
    • Keep progress on our weekly goals with end of week reports to share with our clients.
    • Prepare estimates for feature implementations and bug fixes.
    • Organize my teams in a way that play to my team members' strengths while offering room for them to improve upon their weaknesses.
    • I have experience working on UIs and APIs in Django and React.js in Git version control, WordPress, React Native, as well as with working in older legacy code projects using SFTP.
